noun.description: A deep-bodied freshwater fish, typically with barbels around the mouth. Carp are farmed for food in some parts of the world and are widely kept in large ponds.

verb.description: Complain or find fault continually about trivial matters.
examples: I don't want to carp about the way you did it
he was constantly carping at me

origin: Middle English (in the sense talk, chatter): from Old Norse karpa brag; later influenced by Latin carpere pluck at, slander.
